required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Oral Solution and Crushed Tablet Relative Bioavailability Study of Apixaban When Administered Through a Nasogastric Tube in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Bioavailability of Apixaban Oral Solution Administered Through a Nasogastric Tube in the Presence of Boost® Plus and Apixaban Administered as Crushed Tablet Through a Nasogastric Tube Relative to Apixaban Oral Solution in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the bioavailability of Apixaban oral solution administered through an Nasogastric Tube (NGT) in the presence of Boost® Plus and Apixaban administered as crushed tablet through a nasogastric tube relative to Apixaban solution administered orally in healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) is measured in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL)

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve (AUC) From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time AUC(INF) of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
primary_outcome.description: AUC(INF) is measured in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL)

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-T) is measured in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) is measured in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time [AUC(INF)] of Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(INF) is measured in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean of the Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration [AUC(0-T)] of Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.50, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, 12, 24, 36, 48, 60, 72 hours post-dose for each intervention
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-T) is measured in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Treatment-Related AEs, Deaths or Discontinuation of Study Drug Due to AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Treatment-related=having certain, probable, possible or missing relationship to study drug. Death=during the study and up to 28 days past study discontinuation. The select AEs were determined using the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA, v15.1) and graded using the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), Version 3.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Marked Laboratory Abnormalities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to 30 days after last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Marked laboratory abnormalities were defined as laboratory assessments meeting the following investigator-specified criteria: Leukocytes >1.2* upper limits of normal (ULN) , Basophils >3%, Eosinophils >1.5*ULN, Blood Urine >=2, Red Blood Cell (RBC) Urine >=2, White Blood Cell (WBC) Urine >=2

arm_group.description: Solution Apixaban 5 mg ( 0.4 mg/ml oral solution x 12.5 ml) through mouth or oral syringe
Oral Solution Apixaban 5 mg single dose (0.4 mg/mL oral solution x 12.5 mL) after 180 mL of Boost Plus®, followed by 60 mL of Boost Plus® via same NGT
Single dose crushed Apixaban tablet 5 mg (5 mg tablet crushed and suspended in 60 mL Dextrose 5% in water (D5W)) through NGT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy subjects as determined by no clinically significant deviation from normal in medical history, physical examination, ECGs, and clinical laboratory determinations
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any significant acute or chronic medical illness
- Any history or evidence of abnormal bleeding or coagulation disorders, intracranial hemorrhage, or abnormal bleeding (including heavy menstrual bleeding that has resulted in anemia within the past 1 year) or coagulation disorders in a first degree relative

facility.name: Healthcare Discoveries, LLC D/B/A Icon Development Solutions

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 37 participants were enrolled; 21 were randomized and treated. Reasons for non-randomization include 11 no longer met study criteria, 1 withdrew consent and 4 for other, not specified reasons. 20 participants completed the study; 1 withdrew consent on day 4 of treatment.

group.title: Treatment A, Then Treatment B, Then Treatment C
group.description: Each participant was given three interventions, one per period, with a 4 day washout in between periods Treatment A: Single dose apixaban 5 milligrams (mg) oral solution (OS) (0.4 milligrams per milliliter (mg/mL) x 12.5 milliliters (mL) administered by mouth via oral syringe Treatment B: Single dose apixaban 5 mg OS (0.4 mg/mL x 12.5 mL) administered via nasogastric tube (NGT) after 180 mL of Boost® Plus, followed by 60 mL of Boost® Plus via same NGT Treatment C: Single dose apixaban 5 mg (5 mg tablet crushed and suspended in 60 mL 5% dextrose in water (D5W) administered via NGT

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Treatment-Related AEs, Deaths or Discontinuation of Study Drug Due to AEs
outcome.description: AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Treatment-related=having certain, probable, possible or missing relationship to study drug. Death=during the study and up to 28 days past study discontinuation. The select AEs were determined using the Medical Dictionary for Regulatory Activities (MedDRA, v15.1) and graded using the Cancer Therapy Evaluation Program Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE), Version 3.0

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
